In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

In Julia, you can create the function to wrap a string by checking the length of each word and adding newline characters (`\n`) when necessary. Here is how you could do it:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ") # Split the string into an array of words
    wrapped_text = "" # Initialize the resultant wrapped text as an empty string
    
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"  # Add a newline character when width would be exceeded
        end
        
        wrapped_text *= " $word"  # Append the word to the resultant string after ensuring it doesn't exceed the width
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end
```

You can use this function like so:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."))
```

This will output:

```julia
"Lorem ipsum 
dolor sit 
amet, 
consectetur 
adipiscing 
elit. Sed do 
eiusmod tempor 
incididunt ut labore 
et dolore magna 
aliqua."
```

The function `wrap_string` takes a string as input and wraps it at the specified width by adding new lines when necessary.
